column4: whats the gnome program name for taking a snapshot of your desktop? I want to submit an image of the desktop to image.ca so that I can show people what the desktop looks hoping folks know what package is responsible for the look so i can remove it
uhh how is it convoluted. if no one knows what the desktop looks like how can someone say Oh thats done buy such and such a package?
dr_willis ~ no, i want to remove the package that handles the desktop UI layout and look. the specific one that is making the desktop look like it is
anxiousnut ~ hehe you get that let me know cause it tels me the same thing with my fglrx module installed
dr_willis ~ yes, its not the normal desktop. I want to REVERT back to that, AND i want to revert the gdm theme back to its official default
:( will do if i got the answer
~ will run that as soon as these updates finish installing

so it should have reverted back
and no ubuntu-netbook isn't the problem. i know what THAT one looks like
this looks almost like a BeOS or something
gonna use the gnome-screenshot as soon as these packages finish installing
was doing an apt-get upgrade when i asked the question
hrmm might have to do that tomorrow. running out of battery power on the lappy and there's no plugs :)

trying to mark the apps that were automatically installed as manually installed without having to use the damn interface
i thought it was aptitude unmarkauto ~* but that would mark every single thing in the system wouldn't it?
hehe i was wrong. it's aptitude keep-all
